intro: Pedicularis filicula var. saganaica, commonly known as the saganaica lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, leafless stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in areas with limited soil nutrients. Due to its specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
